numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed a trend about admissions to elite colleges.
2. A legacy applicant is an applicant who has a legacy in a college.
3. People with a legacy in a college have a better chance of getting into this college.
4. This trend exists in the top 0.1% of applicants.
5. An applicant in the top 0.1% is 7 times more likely to get in than a comparable applicant without a legacy.
6. I wonder why the legacy of an applicant is important in admissions.
7. I wonder why the legacy of an applicant is impactful in admissions.
8. A non-legacy applicant may be better than a legacy applicant.
9. However, a non-legacy applicant may be rejected.
10. This issue relates to my community.
11. Many people in my community will apply to colleges soon.
12. Legacy status can be a determining factor in admissions.
13. If legacy status is a determining factor in admissions, then some people in my community could have problems with college acceptance.
14. The headline is: The world of legacy: you are who you are born to.
15. The headline is also: What getting into college is really like nowadays.
